In our state, we have a long tradition of caring for our environment. These Minnesota leaders have valuable tips for all of us so we can remain national leaders in recycling: http://www.startribune.com/how-you-can-help-minnesota-recycle/564882762/ …

But in addition to our work in Congress, we also need an administration that’s willing to promote recycling, not polluters: https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2019/nov/14/america-recycles-day-plastic-pollution-cover …

I’ve also signed on as a co-sponsor of my colleague @Ilhan’s legislation, the #ZeroWasteAct, promoting zero-waste practices to help reduce the overall amount of trash & recyclables and alleviate pressures on the system.

Congress has recognized the need to promote a comprehensive strategy. I led the FY20 @AppropsDems Interior-Environment bill, which directs @EPA to create a #NationalRecyclingStrategy to develop nationwide labeling standards.

Today is #AmericaRecyclesDay.

Recycling is so important – but it’s facing crisis in America because of the absence of a national strategy.

Today is the grand opening of the new National Children’s Museum! I was proud to support funding for @NatChildrens, which will be a much-needed space for children & adults to learn and have fun by exploring STEAM-based lessons & exhibits. Plan your visit: https://nationalchildrensmuseum.org/

Metropolitan Council Chair Nora Slawik has been an east metro leader for decades, and I always viewed her as a trusted partner on securing federal investments for our community. Her unanticipated departure is a big loss.

Read my full statement here: https://bit.ly/36t0d6b

A fun tradition: Every new @SmithsonianSec is presented with a ceremonial brass key that once opened one of the massive oak doors of the Smithsonian Castle! You can watch the Installation Ceremony for 14th Sec. Lonnie G. Bunch III live at 3pm ET/2pm CT: https://www.si.edu/about/secretary-lonnie-bunch/installation …
